We need to produce JSON for the file-level metadata and function summaries. The file is tests/test_application.py. We have many class test suites. The request: "standalone_function_summaries:" then blank. So there are no standalone functions, only classes. We need to output a JSON object with summary, business_intent, keywords for the file/module responsibility. Not per class. So we need to summarize the whole test file. The file contains many test classes covering various aspects of authentication library: client capabilities, token refresh behaviors, bytes conversion, error handling, FOCI behaviors, authority migration, account grouping, certificate extraction, telemetry offline state, telemetry on client, confidential client, public client, etc.

Thus overall summary: This test module provides comprehensive unit tests for the authentication library's application components, covering token acquisition, refresh, error handling, client capabilities, authority migration, account management, certificate extraction, and telemetry behavior across different client types and offline scenarios.

Business intent: Ensure reliability, correctness, and compliance of the authentication library by validating its core functionalities and edge cases, supporting robust authentication flows in production.

Keywords: authentication, unit tests, token acquisition, token refresh, client capabilities, authority migration, account management, certificate extraction, telemetry, offline caching, FOCI, error handling, MSAL, Microsoft identity, testing.

Now produce JSON with those keys. Ensure no method names verbatim. Provide concise summary.

assistantfinal{
  "summary": "A comprehensive test suite for the authentication library's application layer, covering token acquisition (including silent, device, auth‑code, refresh, client‑credential, and on‑behalf‑of flows), token refresh logic, client capabilities, authority migration, account grouping, certificate extraction, and telemetry handling across online and offline scenarios.",
  "business_intent": "Validate the correctness, robustness, and compliance of the authentication components to ensure reliable identity management and seamless user experiences in production environments.",
  "keywords": [
    "authentication",
    "unit testing",
    "token acquisition",
    "token refresh",
    "client capabilities",

    "account management",
    "certificate extraction",
    "telemetry",

    "FOCI",
    "error handling",
    "MSAL",
    "Microsoft identity"
  ]
}
